quote: No spring nor summer hath such grace as I have seen in one autumnal face.
author: John Donne

quote: The secret of life, though, is to fall seven times and to get up eight times.
author: Paulo Coelho

quote: One cannot think well, love well, sleep well, if one has not dined well.
author: Virginia Woolf

quote: A mask tells us more than a face.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: One cannot think well, love well, sleep well, if one has not dined well.
author: Virginia Woolf

quote: The world is a book, and those who do not travel read only one page.
author: St. Augustine
authorCaption: North African Christian theologian and philosopher

quote: There is nothing better than a friend, unless it is a friend with chocolate.
author: Linda Grayson

quote: Cultivation of mind should be the ultimate aim of human existence.
author: B. R. Ambedkar
authorCaption: Indian jurist, economist, social reformer and political leader

quote: Nothing in life is to be feared, it is only to be understood. Now is the time to understand more, so that we may fear less.
author: Marie Curie

quote: To be secure on land, we must be supreme at sea.
author: Jawaharlal Nehru
authorCaption: Indian independence activist, later the first Prime Minister of India

quote: The sands of time are quicksands...so much can sink into them without a trace.
author: Margaret Atwood

quote: Do everything you have to do, but not with ego, not with lust, not with envy but with love, compassion, humility, and devotion.
author: Lord Krishna

quote: Climbing to the top demands strength, whether it is to the top of Mount Everest or to the top of your career.
author: A.P.J. Abdul Kalam
authorCaption: Indian aerospace scientist and politician who served as president of India from 2002 to 2007

quote: If you can't feed a hundred people, then feed just one.
author: Mother Teresa

quote: When I despair, I remember that all through history the way of truth and love have always won. There have been tyrants and murderers, and for a time, they can seem invincible, but in the end, they always fall. Think of it – always.
author: Mahatma Gandhi
authorCaption: Indian independence activist, lawyer and Indian political leader

quote: Children are like buds in a garden and should be carefully and lovingly nurtured, as they are the future of the nation and the citizens of tomorrow.
author: Jawaharlal Nehru
authorCaption: Indian independence activist, later the first Prime Minister of India

quote: The greatness of humanity is not in being human, but in being humane.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: Funny way to get to a wizards' school, the train. Magic carpets all got punctures, have they?
author: Vernon Dursley

quote: Clouds come floating into my life, no longer to carry rain or usher storm, but to add color to my sunset sky.
author: Rabindranath Tagore

quote: You come into this world with nothing, and you go empty-handed. The wealth of life lies in how you allow its experiences to enrich you.
author: Sadhguru

quote: The organs are the horses, the mind is the rein, the intellect is the charioteer, the soul is the rider, and the body is the chariot.
author: Swami Vivekananda
authorCaption: Indian Hindu monk, philosopher, and author

quote: A person often meets his destiny on the road he took to avoid it.
author: Jean de La Fontaine

quote: Everything repeats. Am I going in circles, or dare I hope I am on a spiral?
author: Clive Staples Lewis
authorCaption: British writer, known for 'The Chronicles of Narnia'

quote: I have tried to do what is true and not ideal.
author: Henri de Toulouse-Lautrec

quote: I hold that a strongly marked personality can influence descendants for generations.
author: Beatrix Potter

quote: The fate of animals is of far greater importance to me than the fear of appearing ridiculous.
author: Émile Zola
authorCaption: French novelist, critic, and political activist

quote: I have a theory that selflessness and bravery aren't all that different.
author: Veronica Roth

quote: There is nothing more deceptive than an obvious fact.
author: Sherlock Holmes
authorCaption: Fictional detective created by Arthur Conan Doyle

quote: Blessed is the season which engages the whole world in a conspiracy of love.
author: Hamilton Wright Mabie

quote: The world is a drama, staged in a dream.
author: Guru Nanak
authorCaption: Founder and first Guru of Sikhism

quote: The Analytical Engine weaves algebraic patterns, just as the Jacquard loom weaves flowers and leaves.
author: Ada Lovelace

quote: Life would be tragic if it weren’t funny.
author: Stephen Hawking

quote: You find me at work; excuse the dust on my blouse. I sculpt my marble myself.
author: Camille Claudel

quote: A hermit is simply a person to whom civilization has failed to adjust itself.
author: Will Cuppy
